title: Finally, we know production costs for SLS and Orion, and they’re wild
summary: Someone finally said the quiet part out loud.

title: Lockheed Martin plots U.K. satellite manufacturing base
summary: Lockheed Martin is looking to set up a satellite manufacturing base in the United Kingdom to expand its global space business, the U.S.-based aerospace and defense giant said March 1.

title: Lockheed Martin selects Raytheon to supply a second payload for missile-warning satellites
summary: Lockheed Martin announced March 1 it has selected Raytheon Technologies to supply a second payload for the Next Generation Overhead Persistent Infrared (Next Gen OPIR) geosynchronous satellites.

title: Ohio Students to Hear from NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
summary: Students from across the state of Ohio will have an opportunity this week to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: Boeing increases use of 3D printing to speed up production of WGS military satellite
summary: Boeing is 3D printing more than a thousand parts for WGS-11+, a new communications satellite it is producing for the U.S. Space Force

title: Ukraine official confirms urgent request for Western satellite data
summary: "Within one hour, there will be an attack on Kyiv again."

title: Russia looks to China for collaboration in space but faces isolation over Ukraine invasion
summary: Roscosmos is looking to China as a supplier of components and a partner in missions following the invasion of Ukraine, but sanctions could still heavily impact any new plans.

title: SpaceX awarded three more NASA astronaut launch contracts
summary: Three months after announcing its intent, NASA has procured three more Crew Dragon astronaut launches from SpaceX, raising the total number of...

title: ISS operations remain normal ahead of private astronaut mission
summary: NASA said that operations of the International Space Station remain normal despite the growing rift between Russia and the West in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Rocket Lab launches Electron rocket, selects Virginia for Neutron factory
summary: Rocket Lab carried out its first Electron launch of the year Feb. 28, placing a Japanese radar imaging satellite into orbit at the same time the company released its financial results and selected Virginia for a rocket factory.
